news_header: Tax Administration negotiations concluded with potential layoffs and unchanged denunciation numbers.
news_text: The Tax Administration announced the end of negotiations, estimating that up to 200 employees may be laid off, while the number of denunciations has remained consistent. Approximately 30 individuals affected by the layoffs may be reassigned to other positions. Decisions regarding redundancies and potential official arrangements are expected to be made within the year. As of September, the agency had around 900 employees, and the layoffs are aimed at roles where work has significantly decreased due to various factors, including restructuring and changing work habits, impacting government savings.
